channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report E-2025010181
item.description:
Report E-2025010181

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails flipping over in the trailer and leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and damaged container and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. Three (3) 5-gallon poly drums were also used to contain three additional jugs of product due to contamination. A total of five (5) 5-gallon poly drums of waste were generated from this spill. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010171
item.description:
Report E-2025010171

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: ELIZABETHTOWN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver stopped to get fuel and when he was performing a walk around he noticed liquid dripping from the back of the trailer at 1130 et. The driver then put down som absorbent and called our emergency number. A team was dispatched to the truck stop and arrived around 1300 et. They found that one of the IBC flexible bags was leaking and began to repack them into a new container cleaning up any material with absorbents. The container was repacked and everything was cleaned up by 1500et and the driver was sent on his way.

item.title: Report E-2025010115
item.description:
Report E-2025010115

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: SONORA
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7580
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was pumping diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank when the delivery hose ruptured. Approximately 20 gallons of diesel fuel was released. First Call Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2025010094
item.description:
Report E-2025010094

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to the drum being punctured while loading other freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. An additional one (1) 85-gallon poly drum contains the punctured 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
